lu.uni.geko.weaver.merge
Class Merger

java.lang.Object
  lu.uni.geko.weaver.merge.Merger

public class Merger
extends Object

The class responsible for merging elements during the weaving. It stores the information of the advice and advice effectuation for which it is used and initiates all needed merges of base and advice elements.

Field Summary
private  Advice advice
          The advice for which this merger is used.
private  AdviceEffectuation avEffectuation
          The advice effectuation for which this merger is used.
private  org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil.Copier baseCopier
          The copier used for duplicating base elements.
private  Map<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject,Set<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature>> baseElements2FeatureConflictsMap
          The mapping from base elements to the set of feature conflicts.

What feature conflicts are:
Whenever two or more base elements are mapped to an advice element this results in a merge of these base elements.
One of the base elements will be kept and the attributes and references of all the other base elements are introduced to this kept base element.
During these subsequent merge operations of two base elements it may happen that both have a feature value that allows for exactly one value.
As all base elements are handled in the same way we cannot decide which feature value to keep.
Therefore we register every conflicting feature value of every base object.
Such a conflict can be resolved whenever an advice element sets such a feature value (as it means that whatever was set before is overwritten).
When all registered conflicts are resolved like this at the end of the merge we are happy.
private  SimpleMessageConsole console
          Convenient access to the message console.
private  FeatureEquivalenceHelper featureEquivalenceHelper
          The feature equivalence helper for this merger.
private  Map<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject,org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> merged2KeptBaseElementMap
          The mapping from merged base elements to the base element that was kept for them.
private  org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject wovenRoot
          The root element of the woven model.

          Performs the merges for this merger by iterating over all base to advice merge entries of the advice effectuation of this merger.
 FeatureEquivalenceHelper performMergesAndReturnFeatureEquivalenceHelper()

          Registers the given advice feature value as already added in the advice effectuation of this merger if its base variant is contained using the given base feature as containment feature.

Attention: As a side-effect, the advice feature value and all its content are removed from the set of remaining advice elements to be added of the advice effectuation of this merger.

          Replaces all references to base element that have been merged with other base elements with references to the kept base elements.

baseElements2FeatureConflictsMap

private final Map<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject,Set<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature>> baseElements2FeatureConflictsMap
The mapping from base elements to the set of feature conflicts.

What feature conflicts are:
Whenever two or more base elements are mapped to an advice element this results in a merge of these base elements.
One of the base elements will be kept and the attributes and references of all the other base elements are introduced to this kept base element.
During these subsequent merge operations of two base elements it may happen that both have a feature value that allows for exactly one value.
As all base elements are handled in the same way we cannot decide which feature value to keep.
Therefore we register every conflicting feature value of every base object.
Such a conflict can be resolved whenever an advice element sets such a feature value (as it means that whatever was set before is overwritten).
When all registered conflicts are resolved like this at the end of the merge we are happy. Otherwise we issue an error.

merged2KeptBaseElementMap

private final Map<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject,org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> merged2KeptBaseElementMap
The mapping from merged base elements to the base element that was kept for them.

avEffectuation - an advice effectuation
wovenMURI - the URI of a woven model
Method Detail

performMergesAndReturnFeatureEquivalenceHelper

public FeatureEquivalenceHelper performMergesAndReturnFeatureEquivalenceHelper()
Performs all merges required for this merger and returns the feature equivalence helper that was used during the merge. Throws a RuntimeException when not all feature value conflicts have been resolved after all merges have been performed.

Attention: As a side-effect, the advice elements that became a content of a model element during a merge are removed from the set of remaining advice elements to be added of the advice effectuation of this merger.

Returns:
the feature equivalence helper

performMerges

private void performMerges()
Performs the merges for this merger by iterating over all base to advice merge entries of the advice effectuation of this merger.

Merges the given single base element with the given multiple advice elements.

Parameters:
baseElement - a base element
avElementsMapEntrySet - the original set from the base to advice merge map containing the advice elements to be merged with the given base element

ensureReferenceDoesNotExceedUpperBound

private boolean ensureReferenceDoesNotExceedUpperBound(int currentSize,
                                                       org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature referencingFeature,
                                                       List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elementsToReference,
                                                       org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject referencedElement,
                                                       org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject referencingElement)
Ensures that the given current size does not exceed the upper bound for the given referencing feature and the given elements to be referenced by throwing a RuntimeException if it is the case and returning true otherwise. The given referenced and referencing elements are only used for output.

Parameters:
currentSize - the current total number of referenced elements
referencingFeature - the referencing structural feature
elementsToReference - the list of elements to be newly referenced
referencedElement - the referenced element
referencingElement - the referencing element
Returns:
true if the upper bound of the given reference is not exceeded once the given elements to be referenced are newly referenced

Merges the given first base element with the given second base element feature-wise while keeping the first element.

Parameters:
keptBaseEObject - a base element to be merged with the given second base element so that it is kept as entity
disappearingBaseEObject - a base element to be merged with the given first base element so that it disappears

baseMergeEquivalentManyFeature

private void baseMergeEquivalentManyFeature(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject keptBaseElement,
                                            org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject disappearingBaseElement,
                                            org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature keptFeature,
                                            org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature disappearingFeature)
Merges the given many feature of the given base elements while keeping the first element.

Parameters:
keptBaseElement - a base element to be merged with the given second base element so that it is kept as entity
disappearingBaseElement - a base element to be merged with the given first base element so that it disappears
keptFeature - the feature of the base element to be kept
disappearingFeature - the feature of the base element to disappear

ensureMergeDoesNotExceedUpperBound

private boolean ensureMergeDoesNotExceedUpperBound(List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> targetFeatureValues,
                                                   org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature targetFeature,
                                                   List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elementsToAdd,
                                                   org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject targetElement,
                                                   org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject sourceElement)
Ensures that the upper bound of the given feature will not be exceeded in case the given elements are added to it during the merge of the given source and target element. Throws a RuntimeException if the upper bound will be exceeded and returns true otherwise. The given source and target element are only used for output.

Parameters:
targetFeatureValues - the current values of the given feature
targetFeature - the structural feature
elementsToAdd - the list of elements to be added to the feature during the merge
targetElement - the target element to be merged
sourceElement - the source element to be merged
Returns:
true if the upper bound of the given feature is not exceeded once the given elements are added

baseMergeEquivalentNotManyFeature

                                               org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature disappearingFeature)
Merges the given not-many feature of the given base elements while keeping the first element.

Parameters:
keptBaseElement - a base element to be merged with the given second base element so that it is kept as entity
disappearingBaseElement - a base element to be merged with the given first base element so that it disappears
keptFeature - the feature of the base element to be kept
disappearingFeature - the feature of the base element to disappear

disappearingFeature - the feature of the base element to disappear

registerAvFeatureValueAsAddedIfDone

private void registerAvFeatureValueAsAddedIfDone(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject adviceFeatureValue,
                                                 org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject baseVariantOfAdviceFeatureValue,
                                                 org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EStructuralFeature baseFeature)
Registers the given advice feature value as already added in the advice effectuation of this merger if its base variant is contained using the given base feature as containment feature.

Attention: As a side-effect, the advice feature value and all its content are removed from the set of remaining advice elements to be added of the advice effectuation of this merger.

Parameters:
adviceFeatureValue - a feature value of an advice element
baseVariantOfAdviceFeatureValue - the base variant of the given advice feature value
baseFeature - a base feature that may be the containment feature of the given base variant advice feature value

replaceReferencesToMergedBaseElements

private void replaceReferencesToMergedBaseElements()
Replaces all references to base element that have been merged with other base elements with references to the kept base elements.

allBaseWithBaseMergeFeatureConflictsResolved

private boolean allBaseWithBaseMergeFeatureConflictsResolved()
Returns whether all base with base merge feature conflicts have been resolved.

Returns:
true when all feature conflicts have been resolved and false otherwise
See Also:
baseElements2FeatureConflictsMap
